required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy, Safety, and Tolerability of SPD489 in Adults With Schizophrenia and Predominant Negative Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter Study With Open-label & Randomized Double-blind Placebo-controlled Withdrawal Phases to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety, & Tolerability of SPD489 in Adults With Schizophrenia & Predominant Negative Symptoms Who Are Clinically Stable & Taking Stable Doses of Atypical Antipsychotic Medication

brief_summary.textblock: To explore the efficacy of SPD489, as adjunctive therapy to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication, on negative symptoms in adult subjects with clinically stable schizophrenia and predominant negative symptoms, as measured by the Scale for the Assessment of Negative Symptoms (SANS).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in Modified Scale for the Assessment of Negative Symptoms (SANS-18) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase, Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10 Open-label Phase
primary_outcome.description: The SANS was modified by eliminating the global and attention items; the score of the remaining non-global items is referred to as the SANS-18 total score. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in SANS-18 Total Score at Week 4 Double-blind Phase, Termination Observation Carried Forward (TOCF)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase
primary_outcome.description: The SANS was modified by eliminating the global and attention items; the score of the remaining non-global items is referred to as the SANS-18 total score. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants In Open-label Phase Who Were SANS-18 Responders at Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Response is defined as reduction in total SANS score of greater than or equal to 20%. The SANS was modified by eliminating the global and attention items; the score of the remaining non-global items is referred to as the SANS-18 total score. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants In Double-blind Phase Who Maintained SANS-18 Response at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: Response is defined as reduction in total SANS score of greater than or equal to 20%. The SANS was modified by eliminating the global and attention items; the score of the remaining non-global items is referred to as the SANS-18 total score. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in SANS Global Scores at Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.description: The SANS assesses 5 symptom complexes to rate the negative symptoms of subjects. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in SANS Global Scores at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: The SANS assesses 5 symptom complexes to rate the negative symptoms of subjects. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Scores at Week 10 Open-label Phase, LOCF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.description: The PANSS is a validated measure that evaluates the presence, absence, and severity of 30 symptoms of schizophrenia including both positive and negative symptoms and general psychopathology. Each of the 30-items are rated on a scale of 1 (absent) to 7 (extreme) with a total scoring range of 30 to 210. Higher scores indicate more impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in PANSS Scores at Week 4 Double-blind Phase, TOCF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: The PANSS is a validated measure that evaluates the presence, absence, and severity of 30 symptoms of schizophrenia including both positive and negative symptoms and general psychopathology. Each of the 30-items are rated on a scale of 1 (absent) to 7 (extreme) with a total scoring range of 30 to 210. Higher scores indicate more impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants With Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness (CGI-S) at Open-label Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants With CGI-S at Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants With CGI-S at Double-blind Randomization Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants With CGI-S at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants With Improvement on Clinical Global Impression - Change (CGI-C) at Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Phase Week 10
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-C permits a global evaluation of the change of the subject's overall schizophrenia condition over time. It consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent of Participants With Improvement on CGI-C at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Phase Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-C permits a global evaluation of the change of the subject's overall schizophrenia condition over time. It consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in the Brief Assessment of Cognition in Schizophrenia (BACS) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.description: BACS measures attention and speed of processing, and the test score is the total number correct. The measure of the test is the number of correct numerals where subjects write numerals 1-9 as matches to nonmeaningful symbols on a response sheet for 90 seconds, based upon a key provided to them.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in BACS Total Score at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: BACS measures attention and speed of processing, and the test score is the total number correct. The measure of the test is the number of correct numerals where subjects write numerals 1-9 as matches to nonmeaningful symbols on a response sheet for 90 seconds, based upon a key provided to them.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in Letter-Number Span Test (LNS) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.description: LNS is a test of verbal working memory. Subjects are presented with a sequence of numbers and letters aurally and then asked to tell the rater the numbers first from lowest to highest followed by the letters in alphabetical sequence. The measure is the number of correct sequences.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in LNS Total Score at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: LNS is a test of verbal working memory. Subjects are presented with a sequence of numbers and letters aurally and then asked to tell the rater the numbers first from lowest to highest followed by the letters in alphabetical sequence. The measure is the number of correct sequences.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in Hopkins Verbal Learning Test - Revised (HVLT-R) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10
secondary_outcome.description: HVLT-R measures verbal learning. Test scores are the total number of words recalled correctly over 3 trials. The test consists of 12 nouns read aloud for 3 consecutive trials and each trial is followed by a recall test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in HVLT-R Total Scores at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: HVLT-R measures verbal learning. Test scores are the total number of words recalled correctly over 3 trials. The test consists of 12 nouns read aloud for 3 consecutive trials and each trial is followed by a recall test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in University of California Performance-Based Skills Assessment, Brief Version (UPSA-B) Scores at Week 10 Open-label Phase, LOCF
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.description: UPSA-B assesses skills in 5 areas of life functioning. It contains 2 subscales. Percentages correct on these 2 subscales are multiplied by 50. Thus, scores can range from 0 to 50 on each of these 2 subscales, and total scores can range from 0 to 100. Scores of 75 or higher are associated with independent living.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in UPSA-B Scores at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: UPSA-B assesses skills in 5 areas of life functioning. It contains 2 subscales. Percentages correct on these 2 subscales are multiplied by 50. Thus, scores can range from 0 to 50 on each of these 2 subscales, and total scores can range from 0 to 100. Scores of 75 or higher are associated with independent living.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in Behavioral Rating Inventory of Executive Function - Adult Version (BRIEF-A) T-scores at Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.description: BRIEF-A is a validated 75-item questionnaire composed of three indexes (Global Executive Composite, Behavioral Recognition Index, and Metacognition Index). Items are rated 1 (never), 2 (sometimes), and 3 (often). Raw scale scores are used to generate T-scores. A reduction in score indicates less impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in BRIEF-A T-Scores at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: BRIEF-A is a validated 75-item questionnaire composed of three indexes (Global Executive Composite, Behavioral Recognition Index, and Metacognition Index). Items are rated 1 (never), 2 (sometimes), and 3 (often). Raw scale scores are used to generate T-scores. A reduction in score indicates less impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in Simpson Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.description: SAS is a 10-item scale used to evaluate the presence and severity of extrapyramidal symptoms. The items are scored on a scale from 0 to 4 with item-specific definitions given for each point. Total scores range from 0 to 40. Lower scores indicate less impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in SAS Total Score at Week 4 of Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: SAS is a 10-item scale used to evaluate the presence and severity of extrapyramidal symptoms. The items are scored on a scale from 0 to 4 with item-specific definitions given for each point. Total scores range from 0 to 40. Lower scores indicate less impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in Barnes Akathisia Scale (BAS) Scores at Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.description: BAS scale has objective, subjective, and global impression components of akathisia (motor restlessness that manifests itself with an inability to sit still or remain motionless). Objective and subjective components are rated on a scale from 0 (normal/absence) to 3 (severe) and are summed yielding a total score of 0 to 9. Global impression is rated on a scale from 0 (absent) to 5 (severe) with a total score ranging from 0 to 5. Lower scores indicate reduced restlessness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in BAS Scores at Week 4 of Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: BAS scale has objective, subjective, and global impression components of akathisia (motor restlessness that manifests itself with an inability to sit still or remain motionless). Objective and subjective components are rated on a scale from 0 (normal/absence) to 3 (severe) and are summed yielding a total score of 0 to 9. Global impression is rated on a scale from 0 (absent) to 5 (severe) with a total score ranging from 0 to 5. Lower scores indicate reduced restlessness.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in Amphetamine Cessation Symptom Assessment (ACSA) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.description: ACSA scale has 16 symptom items rated on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely) with a possible total score range of 0 to 64. Higher scores indicate greater withdrawal symptom severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in ACSA Total Score at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: ACSA scale has 16 symptom items rated on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely) with a possible total score range of 0 to 64. Higher scores indicate greater withdrawal symptom severity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) Total Global Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.description: PSQI evaluates 7 areas of quality and pattern of sleep. Each area is rated on a scale from 0 (better) to 3 (worse) with a total score ranging from 0 to 21. Reduction in total scores are associated with better sleep quality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in PSQI Total Global Score at Week 4 of Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: PSQI evaluates 7 areas of quality and pattern of sleep. Each area is rated on a scale from 0 (better) to 3 (worse) with a total score ranging from 0 to 21. Reduction in total scores are associated with better sleep quality.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in Calgary Depression Scale for Schizophrenia (CDSS) at Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10 Open-label Phase
secondary_outcome.description: CDSS is a 9-item scale to evaluate depression in subjects who have schizophrenia rated from 0 (absence of symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with a total score range of 0 to 27. Lower scores indicate less depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Open-label Baseline in CDSS at Week 4 of Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 4 of Double-blind Phase
secondary_outcome.description: CDSS is a 9-item scale to evaluate depression in subjects who have schizophrenia rated from 0 (absence of symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with a total score range of 0 to 27. Lower scores indicate less depression.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 18-55
- Clinically stable Schizophrenia and predominant negative symptoms
- Taking a stable dose of antipsychotic medication
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically notable positive symptoms defined by PANSS

overall_official.affiliation: NY University School of Medicine Manhattan Psych Center

facility.name: Neuropsychiatric Research Center of Orange County
Medical Research Group of Central Florida

results_reference.citation: Lasser RA, Dirks B, Nasrallah H, Kirsch C, Gao J, Pucci ML, Knesevich MA, Lindenmayer JP. Adjunctive lisdexamfetamine dimesylate therapy in adult outpatients with predominant negative symptoms of schizophrenia: open-label and randomized-withdrawal phases. Neuropsychopharmacology. 2013 Oct;38(11):2140-9. doi: 10.1038/npp.2013.111. Epub 2013 May 8.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: The study consisted of a 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20 to 70 mg of SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily. They were then randomized into the Double-Blind Phase receiving either their optimal dose of SPD489 or placebo once-daily for 4 weeks.

group.title: SPD489
group.description: The study consisted of a 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication. They were then randomized into the Double-Blind Phase receiving either their optimal dose of adjunctive SPD489 or placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Subjects received placebo once-daily for 4 weeks during the Double-blind Phase to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.title: Overall
group.description: Constitutes all subjects contained in the Safety Analysis Set defined as all subjects who took at least 1 dose of open-label investigational product and for whom at least 1 follow-up safety assessment was made.

measure.title: Age
Age, Customized
Gender
Region of Enrollment

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Modified Scale for the Assessment of Negative Symptoms (SANS-18) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase, Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)
outcome.description: The SANS was modified by eliminating the global and attention items; the score of the remaining non-global items is referred to as the SANS-18 total score. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10 Open-label Phase
outcome.population: Open-label Phase Full Analysis Set (FAS) defined as all enrolled subjects who took at least 1 dose of the investigational product and had 1 primary efficacy assessment after baseline in the Open-label Phase.

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Modified Scale for the Assessment of Negative Symptoms (SANS-18) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase, Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)
measure.description: The SANS was modified by eliminating the global and attention items; the score of the remaining non-global items is referred to as the SANS-18 total score. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.
measure.population: Open-label Phase Full Analysis Set (FAS) defined as all enrolled subjects who took at least 1 dose of the investigational product and had 1 primary efficacy assessment after baseline in the Open-label Phase.

outcome.title: Percent of Participants In Open-label Phase Who Were SANS-18 Responders at Week 10 Open-label Phase
outcome.description: Response is defined as reduction in total SANS score of greater than or equal to 20%. The SANS was modified by eliminating the global and attention items; the score of the remaining non-global items is referred to as the SANS-18 total score. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.
outcome.time_frame: Week 10 Open-label Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Percent of Participants In Open-label Phase Who Were SANS-18 Responders at Week 10 Open-label Phase
measure.description: Response is defined as reduction in total SANS score of greater than or equal to 20%. The SANS was modified by eliminating the global and attention items; the score of the remaining non-global items is referred to as the SANS-18 total score. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.

outcome.title: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in SANS-18 Total Score at Week 4 Double-blind Phase, Termination Observation Carried Forward (TOCF)
outcome.description: The SANS was modified by eliminating the global and attention items; the score of the remaining non-global items is referred to as the SANS-18 total score. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.
outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase
outcome.population: Randomized Evaluable Set (RES) defined as all randomized subjects who were responders (Response is defined as reduction in total SANS score of greater than or equal to 20%) at the Double-blind Randomization and had SANS-18 total scores at week 4 of the Double-blind Phase or the early termination visit.

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive optimal dose (20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg) of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.description: The SANS was modified by eliminating the global and attention items; the score of the remaining non-global items is referred to as the SANS-18 total score. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.

The SANS was modified by eliminating the global and attention items; the score of the remaining non-global items is referred to as the SANS-18 total score. Each of the 18-items is scored on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 5 (severe) with a total scoring range of 0 to 90. Higher scores indicate more impairment.
outcome.time_frame: Week 4 Double-blind Phase

outcome.description: The PANSS is a validated measure that evaluates the presence, absence, and severity of 30 symptoms of schizophrenia including both positive and negative symptoms and general psychopathology. Each of the 30-items are rated on a scale of 1 (absent) to 7 (extreme) with a total scoring range of 30 to 210. Higher scores indicate more impairment.

measure.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS) Scores at Week 10 Open-label Phase, LOCF
measure.description: The PANSS is a validated measure that evaluates the presence, absence, and severity of 30 symptoms of schizophrenia including both positive and negative symptoms and general psychopathology. Each of the 30-items are rated on a scale of 1 (absent) to 7 (extreme) with a total scoring range of 30 to 210. Higher scores indicate more impairment.

outcome.description: The PANSS is a validated measure that evaluates the presence, absence, and severity of 30 symptoms of schizophrenia including both positive and negative symptoms and general psychopathology. Each of the 30-items are rated on a scale of 1 (absent) to 7 (extreme) with a total scoring range of 30 to 210. Higher scores indicate more impairment.
outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase
outcome.population: Randomized FAS defined as all subjects who received randomized investigational product and had a SANS-18 total scores at week 4 or at the early termination visit.

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive optimal dose (20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg) of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in PANSS Scores at Week 4 Double-blind Phase, TOCF
measure.description: The PANSS is a validated measure that evaluates the presence, absence, and severity of 30 symptoms of schizophrenia including both positive and negative symptoms and general psychopathology. Each of the 30-items are rated on a scale of 1 (absent) to 7 (extreme) with a total scoring range of 30 to 210. Higher scores indicate more impairment.
measure.population: Randomized FAS defined as all subjects who received randomized investigational product and had a SANS-18 total scores at week 4 or at the early termination visit.

outcome.title: Percent of Participants With Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness (CGI-S) at Open-label Baseline
outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Percent of Participants With Clinical Global Impression - Severity of Illness (CGI-S) at Open-label Baseline
measure.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

outcome.title: Percent of Participants With CGI-S at Week 10 Open-label Phase
outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)
outcome.time_frame: Week 10 Open-label Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Percent of Participants With CGI-S at Week 10 Open-label Phase
measure.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

outcome.title: Percent of Participants With CGI-S at Double-blind Randomization Baseline
outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)
outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive optimal dose (20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg) of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Percent of Participants With CGI-S at Double-blind Randomization Baseline
measure.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

outcome.title: Percent of Participants With CGI-S at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)
outcome.time_frame: Week 4 Double-blind Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive optimal dose (20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg) of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Percent of Participants With CGI-S at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
measure.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

outcome.title: Percent of Participants With Improvement on Clinical Global Impression - Change (CGI-C) at Week 10 Open-label Phase
outcome.description: CGI-C permits a global evaluation of the change of the subject's overall schizophrenia condition over time. It consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Phase Week 10

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Percent of Participants With Improvement on Clinical Global Impression - Change (CGI-C) at Week 10 Open-label Phase
measure.description: CGI-C permits a global evaluation of the change of the subject's overall schizophrenia condition over time. It consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

outcome.title: Percent of Participants With Improvement on CGI-C at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
outcome.description: CGI-C permits a global evaluation of the change of the subject's overall schizophrenia condition over time. It consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.
outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Phase Week 4

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive optimal dose (20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg) of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Percent of Participants With Improvement on CGI-C at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
measure.description: CGI-C permits a global evaluation of the change of the subject's overall schizophrenia condition over time. It consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in the Brief Assessment of Cognition in Schizophrenia (BACS) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
outcome.description: BACS measures attention and speed of processing, and the test score is the total number correct. The measure of the test is the number of correct numerals where subjects write numerals 1-9 as matches to nonmeaningful symbols on a response sheet for 90 seconds, based upon a key provided to them.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and week 10 Open-label Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in the Brief Assessment of Cognition in Schizophrenia (BACS) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
measure.description: BACS measures attention and speed of processing, and the test score is the total number correct. The measure of the test is the number of correct numerals where subjects write numerals 1-9 as matches to nonmeaningful symbols on a response sheet for 90 seconds, based upon a key provided to them.

outcome.title: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in BACS Total Score at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
outcome.description: BACS measures attention and speed of processing, and the test score is the total number correct. The measure of the test is the number of correct numerals where subjects write numerals 1-9 as matches to nonmeaningful symbols on a response sheet for 90 seconds, based upon a key provided to them.
outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive optimal dose (20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg) of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in BACS Total Score at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
measure.description: BACS measures attention and speed of processing, and the test score is the total number correct. The measure of the test is the number of correct numerals where subjects write numerals 1-9 as matches to nonmeaningful symbols on a response sheet for 90 seconds, based upon a key provided to them.

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Letter-Number Span Test (LNS) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
outcome.description: LNS is a test of verbal working memory. Subjects are presented with a sequence of numbers and letters aurally and then asked to tell the rater the numbers first from lowest to highest followed by the letters in alphabetical sequence. The measure is the number of correct sequences.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and week 10 Open-label Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Letter-Number Span Test (LNS) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
measure.description: LNS is a test of verbal working memory. Subjects are presented with a sequence of numbers and letters aurally and then asked to tell the rater the numbers first from lowest to highest followed by the letters in alphabetical sequence. The measure is the number of correct sequences.

outcome.title: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in LNS Total Score at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
outcome.description: LNS is a test of verbal working memory. Subjects are presented with a sequence of numbers and letters aurally and then asked to tell the rater the numbers first from lowest to highest followed by the letters in alphabetical sequence. The measure is the number of correct sequences.
outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive optimal dose (20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg) of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in LNS Total Score at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
measure.description: LNS is a test of verbal working memory. Subjects are presented with a sequence of numbers and letters aurally and then asked to tell the rater the numbers first from lowest to highest followed by the letters in alphabetical sequence. The measure is the number of correct sequences.

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Hopkins Verbal Learning Test - Revised (HVLT-R) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
outcome.description: HVLT-R measures verbal learning. Test scores are the total number of words recalled correctly over 3 trials. The test consists of 12 nouns read aloud for 3 consecutive trials and each trial is followed by a recall test.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Hopkins Verbal Learning Test - Revised (HVLT-R) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
measure.description: HVLT-R measures verbal learning. Test scores are the total number of words recalled correctly over 3 trials. The test consists of 12 nouns read aloud for 3 consecutive trials and each trial is followed by a recall test.

outcome.title: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in HVLT-R Total Scores at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
outcome.description: HVLT-R measures verbal learning. Test scores are the total number of words recalled correctly over 3 trials. The test consists of 12 nouns read aloud for 3 consecutive trials and each trial is followed by a recall test.
outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and week 4 Double-blind Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive optimal dose (20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg) of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in HVLT-R Total Scores at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
measure.description: HVLT-R measures verbal learning. Test scores are the total number of words recalled correctly over 3 trials. The test consists of 12 nouns read aloud for 3 consecutive trials and each trial is followed by a recall test.

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in University of California Performance-Based Skills Assessment, Brief Version (UPSA-B) Scores at Week 10 Open-label Phase, LOCF
outcome.description: UPSA-B assesses skills in 5 areas of life functioning. It contains 2 subscales. Percentages correct on these 2 subscales are multiplied by 50. Thus, scores can range from 0 to 50 on each of these 2 subscales, and total scores can range from 0 to 100. Scores of 75 or higher are associated with independent living.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and week 10 Open-label Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in University of California Performance-Based Skills Assessment, Brief Version (UPSA-B) Scores at Week 10 Open-label Phase, LOCF
measure.description: UPSA-B assesses skills in 5 areas of life functioning. It contains 2 subscales. Percentages correct on these 2 subscales are multiplied by 50. Thus, scores can range from 0 to 50 on each of these 2 subscales, and total scores can range from 0 to 100. Scores of 75 or higher are associated with independent living.

outcome.title: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in UPSA-B Scores at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
outcome.description: UPSA-B assesses skills in 5 areas of life functioning. It contains 2 subscales. Percentages correct on these 2 subscales are multiplied by 50. Thus, scores can range from 0 to 50 on each of these 2 subscales, and total scores can range from 0 to 100. Scores of 75 or higher are associated with independent living.
outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive optimal dose (20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg) of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in UPSA-B Scores at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
measure.description: UPSA-B assesses skills in 5 areas of life functioning. It contains 2 subscales. Percentages correct on these 2 subscales are multiplied by 50. Thus, scores can range from 0 to 50 on each of these 2 subscales, and total scores can range from 0 to 100. Scores of 75 or higher are associated with independent living.

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Behavioral Rating Inventory of Executive Function - Adult Version (BRIEF-A) T-scores at Week 10 Open-label Phase
outcome.description: BRIEF-A is a validated 75-item questionnaire composed of three indexes (Global Executive Composite, Behavioral Recognition Index, and Metacognition Index). Items are rated 1 (never), 2 (sometimes), and 3 (often). Raw scale scores are used to generate T-scores. A reduction in score indicates less impairment.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10 Open-label Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Behavioral Rating Inventory of Executive Function - Adult Version (BRIEF-A) T-scores at Week 10 Open-label Phase
measure.description: BRIEF-A is a validated 75-item questionnaire composed of three indexes (Global Executive Composite, Behavioral Recognition Index, and Metacognition Index). Items are rated 1 (never), 2 (sometimes), and 3 (often). Raw scale scores are used to generate T-scores. A reduction in score indicates less impairment.

outcome.title: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in BRIEF-A T-Scores at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
outcome.description: BRIEF-A is a validated 75-item questionnaire composed of three indexes (Global Executive Composite, Behavioral Recognition Index, and Metacognition Index). Items are rated 1 (never), 2 (sometimes), and 3 (often). Raw scale scores are used to generate T-scores. A reduction in score indicates less impairment.
outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive optimal dose (20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg) of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Double-blind Randomization Baseline in BRIEF-A T-Scores at Week 4 Double-blind Phase
measure.description: BRIEF-A is a validated 75-item questionnaire composed of three indexes (Global Executive Composite, Behavioral Recognition Index, and Metacognition Index). Items are rated 1 (never), 2 (sometimes), and 3 (often). Raw scale scores are used to generate T-scores. A reduction in score indicates less impairment.

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Simpson Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
outcome.description: SAS is a 10-item scale used to evaluate the presence and severity of extrapyramidal symptoms. The items are scored on a scale from 0 to 4 with item-specific definitions given for each point. Total scores range from 0 to 40. Lower scores indicate less impairment.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10 Open-label Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Simpson Angus Scale (SAS) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
measure.description: SAS is a 10-item scale used to evaluate the presence and severity of extrapyramidal symptoms. The items are scored on a scale from 0 to 4 with item-specific definitions given for each point. Total scores range from 0 to 40. Lower scores indicate less impairment.

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in SAS Total Score at Week 4 of Double-blind Phase
outcome.description: SAS is a 10-item scale used to evaluate the presence and severity of extrapyramidal symptoms. The items are scored on a scale from 0 to 4 with item-specific definitions given for each point. Total scores range from 0 to 40. Lower scores indicate less impairment.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive optimal dose (20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg) of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in SAS Total Score at Week 4 of Double-blind Phase
measure.description: SAS is a 10-item scale used to evaluate the presence and severity of extrapyramidal symptoms. The items are scored on a scale from 0 to 4 with item-specific definitions given for each point. Total scores range from 0 to 40. Lower scores indicate less impairment.

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Barnes Akathisia Scale (BAS) Scores at Week 10 Open-label Phase
outcome.description: BAS scale has objective, subjective, and global impression components of akathisia (motor restlessness that manifests itself with an inability to sit still or remain motionless). Objective and subjective components are rated on a scale from 0 (normal/absence) to 3 (severe) and are summed yielding a total score of 0 to 9. Global impression is rated on a scale from 0 (absent) to 5 (severe) with a total score ranging from 0 to 5. Lower scores indicate reduced restlessness.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and week 10 Open-label Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Barnes Akathisia Scale (BAS) Scores at Week 10 Open-label Phase
measure.description: BAS scale has objective, subjective, and global impression components of akathisia (motor restlessness that manifests itself with an inability to sit still or remain motionless). Objective and subjective components are rated on a scale from 0 (normal/absence) to 3 (severe) and are summed yielding a total score of 0 to 9. Global impression is rated on a scale from 0 (absent) to 5 (severe) with a total score ranging from 0 to 5. Lower scores indicate reduced restlessness.

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in BAS Scores at Week 4 of Double-blind Phase
outcome.description: BAS scale has objective, subjective, and global impression components of akathisia (motor restlessness that manifests itself with an inability to sit still or remain motionless). Objective and subjective components are rated on a scale from 0 (normal/absence) to 3 (severe) and are summed yielding a total score of 0 to 9. Global impression is rated on a scale from 0 (absent) to 5 (severe) with a total score ranging from 0 to 5. Lower scores indicate reduced restlessness.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase

group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.description: BAS scale has objective, subjective, and global impression components of akathisia (motor restlessness that manifests itself with an inability to sit still or remain motionless). Objective and subjective components are rated on a scale from 0 (normal/absence) to 3 (severe) and are summed yielding a total score of 0 to 9. Global impression is rated on a scale from 0 (absent) to 5 (severe) with a total score ranging from 0 to 5. Lower scores indicate reduced restlessness.

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Amphetamine Cessation Symptom Assessment (ACSA) Total Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
outcome.description: ACSA scale has 16 symptom items rated on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely) with a possible total score range of 0 to 64. Higher scores indicate greater withdrawal symptom severity.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10 Open-label Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.description: ACSA scale has 16 symptom items rated on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely) with a possible total score range of 0 to 64. Higher scores indicate greater withdrawal symptom severity.

outcome.description: ACSA scale has 16 symptom items rated on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely) with a possible total score range of 0 to 64. Higher scores indicate greater withdrawal symptom severity.
outcome.time_frame: Double-blind Randomization Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive optimal dose (20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg) of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.description: ACSA scale has 16 symptom items rated on a scale from 0 (not at all) to 4 (extremely) with a possible total score range of 0 to 64. Higher scores indicate greater withdrawal symptom severity.

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) Total Global Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
outcome.description: PSQI evaluates 7 areas of quality and pattern of sleep. Each area is rated on a scale from 0 (better) to 3 (worse) with a total score ranging from 0 to 21. Reduction in total scores are associated with better sleep quality.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10 Open-label Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Pittsburgh Sleep Quality Index (PSQI) Total Global Score at Week 10 Open-label Phase
measure.description: PSQI evaluates 7 areas of quality and pattern of sleep. Each area is rated on a scale from 0 (better) to 3 (worse) with a total score ranging from 0 to 21. Reduction in total scores are associated with better sleep quality.

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in PSQI Total Global Score at Week 4 of Double-blind Phase
outcome.description: PSQI evaluates 7 areas of quality and pattern of sleep. Each area is rated on a scale from 0 (better) to 3 (worse) with a total score ranging from 0 to 21. Reduction in total scores are associated with better sleep quality.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 4 Double-blind Phase

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive optimal dose (20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg) of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in PSQI Total Global Score at Week 4 of Double-blind Phase
measure.description: PSQI evaluates 7 areas of quality and pattern of sleep. Each area is rated on a scale from 0 (better) to 3 (worse) with a total score ranging from 0 to 21. Reduction in total scores are associated with better sleep quality.

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Calgary Depression Scale for Schizophrenia (CDSS) at Week 10 Open-label Phase
outcome.description: CDSS is a 9-item scale to evaluate depression in subjects who have schizophrenia rated from 0 (absence of symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with a total score range of 0 to 27. Lower scores indicate less depression.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 10 Open-label Phase
outcome.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAS) defined as all subjects who took at least 1 dose of open-label investigational product and for whom at least 1 follow-up safety assessment was made.

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: A 10-week Open-label Phase (7-week Dose Optimization Period and a 3-week Dose maintenance Period) in which subjects received 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in Calgary Depression Scale for Schizophrenia (CDSS) at Week 10 Open-label Phase
measure.description: CDSS is a 9-item scale to evaluate depression in subjects who have schizophrenia rated from 0 (absence of symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with a total score range of 0 to 27. Lower scores indicate less depression.
measure.population: Safety Analysis Set (SAS) defined as all subjects who took at least 1 dose of open-label investigational product and for whom at least 1 follow-up safety assessment was made.

outcome.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in CDSS at Week 4 of Double-blind Phase
outcome.description: CDSS is a 9-item scale to evaluate depression in subjects who have schizophrenia rated from 0 (absence of symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with a total score range of 0 to 27. Lower scores indicate less depression.
outcome.time_frame: Open-label Baseline and Week 4 of Double-blind Phase
outcome.population: Randomized SAS defined as all subjects who took at least 1 dose of randomized investigational product and for whom at least 1 follow-up safety assessment was made.

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive optimal dose (20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg) of adjunctive SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily for 4 weeks to a stable dose of atypical antipsychotic medication.

measure.title: Change From Open-label Baseline in CDSS at Week 4 of Double-blind Phase
measure.description: CDSS is a 9-item scale to evaluate depression in subjects who have schizophrenia rated from 0 (absence of symptoms) to 3 (severe symptoms) with a total score range of 0 to 27. Lower scores indicate less depression.
measure.population: Randomized SAS defined as all subjects who took at least 1 dose of randomized investigational product and for whom at least 1 follow-up safety assessment was made.

reported_events.desc: Safety Analysis Set for both the Open-label and Double-blind Randomization Phases.

group.title: SPD489 (Open-label Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive either 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily

group.title: SPD489 (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive either 20, 30, 40, 50, 60 or 70 mg of SPD489 (Lisdexamfetamine dimesylate) once-daily

group.title: Placebo (Double-blind Phase)
group.description: Subjects receive placebo once-daily

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually.
